attributes.action: Harsher sentences for knife-related offences - act as a powerful deterrent
attributes.additional_details:
The number of knife/sharp instrument recorded offences by the Met Police rose to approximately 12,786 in 2022/23, compared with 11,122 in 2021/2022.
There has been a 76% increase in knife offences in the last 10 years (up to June 2023.) 
Although, figures show just 31.9 per cent of offenders caught with a knife were handed immediate prison terms in the year ending March 2023. So, the Government, Courts to get tougher in order to protect the innocent.
And support your local police, please!
attributes.background:
The minimum sentence from 6 months to one year and the maximum from 4 years to 6 years. 
This increase in knife-related crime demands swift and effective action. Introducing tougher sentences for these offences is one option. Rehabilitation too, where possible.  
Tackling sales of illegal weapons.
